paper.title: Pricing D-dimensional Real Portfolio Options Effect of Many-valued Logic Janusian Thinking on Optimal Investment Decisions
paper.abstract: This work introduces a valuation framework for an option on d real portfolios with price processes for which the martingale assumption does not hold. The model describes how an option holder having imprecise estimates for the portfolio price processes can arrive at single valued estimates using human information processing approaches. A regression-based numerical option-pricing method allows assessing the value of the resulting optimal stopping decisions embedded in the option valuation problem. Theoretical predictions concerning the influence of differences in information processing styles are evaluated in a simulative example. A high tolerance for contraction in information processing modeled using fuzzy set theory does not lead to superior investment decisions.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心内容是介绍一种针对d维实投资组合期权的估值框架，并提出了基于回归的数值期权定价方法，这直接涉及衍生品定价领域。虽然论文也提到了投资决策，但主要研究焦点是期权定价问题。
